titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week” (fols. 3ra-205rb) I-1) Introduction (fols. 3ra-6ra) I-2) Eve of Palm Sunday (fols. 6ra-9rb) I-3) Palm Sunday (fols. 9rb-11vc, 16ra-21vc, 26ra-vb) I-4) Monday (fols. 26vb-50vb) - Night hours (fols. 26vb-30rb) - Day hours (fols. 30rb-50vb), including: Homily by John Chrysostom for Monday morning (fols. 35vb-37ra); Homily by John Chrysostom on the fig tree for Monday morning (fols. 37ra-41vb) I-5) Tuesday (fols. 50vb-74rb) - Night hours (fols. 50vb-54rb) - Day hours (fols. 54rb-74rb) I-6) Wednesday (fols. 74rb-93rc) - Night hours (fols. 74rb-77va) - Day hours (fols. 77va-93rc) I-7) Thursday (fols. 93rc-116vc, 12ra-15rc), fols. misplaced [inserted in Text I-3] - Night hours (fols. 93rc-97ra) - Day hours (fols. 97ra-116vc, 12ra-15rc) I-8) Friday (fols. 15rc-vc, 22ra-25vc, 117ra-191ra), fols. misplaced [inserted in Text I-3] - Night hours (fols. 15rc-vc, 22ra-25vc, 117ra-131rc), including: Homily by John [Chrysostom] on Christ when He says “If it be possible, let this chalice pass” (fols. 118vc-123rc); Tǝmḫǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat “Teaching of Mysteries” (fols. 127va-129rc) - Day hours (fols. 132ra-191ra), including: Homily by Jaqob of Serug on Abraham (fols. 153vc-162va) I-9) Saturday (fols. 191ra-205rb) - Night hours (fols. 191ra-195rb) - Mass (fols. 195rb-200vb) - Evening (fols. 200vb-205rb)
Additio 1; colophon.

copyists.copyist: Albasṭros is mentioned as the scribe in the colophon and in Additio 1.

owners.owner: Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus, baptismal name of Säba Gadis (i.d. Säbagadis, b. 1780/85, d. 1831; s. EAE IV, 430-31), is mentioned as the commissioner of the Ms. in the final supplication formula on fol. 205rb; he is also mentioned in the supplication formula on fol. 41vb.

dcomments.dcomment: Early 19th cent. (?) Säba Gadis (s. above) is mentioned as the commissioner on fol. 205rb. King Bäkaffa (r. 1721-1730; s. EAE I, 449) is also mentioned on fol. 131ra (?).

txstates.txstate: Several fols. (s. “Other details”) are misplaced and rebound within Quire II. The sewing is slightly damaged. Many leaves are affected by humidity especially in the upper part. Fols. 204-205 are damaged at the edges. Fol. 205 is loose. Fols. 1-2 probably coming from another Ms.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold and centre fold of the quires, close to the head and tail of the codex.

inks.ink: Black; red (brilliant vermillion; strong vermillion for the name Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus on fol. 41vb)

squires.squire:
A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(16/fols. 11r-26v) – III(10/fols. 27r-36v) – IV(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 8; 8, stub after 3/fols. 37r-46v) – V(10/fols. 47r-56v) – VI(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 8; 8, stub after 3/fols. 57r-66v) – VII(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 7; 8, stub after 2/fols. 67r-76v) – VIII(8/fols. 77r-84v) – IX(8/fols. 85r-92v) – X(8/fols. 93r-100v) – XI(8/fols. 101r-108v) – XII(8/fols. 109r-116v) – XIII(10/fols. 117r-126v) – XIV(5; s.l.: 1, stub after 5/fols. 127r-131v) – XV(8/fols. 132r-139v) – XVI(8/fols. 140r-147v) – XVII(8/fols. 148r-155v) – XVIII(8/fols. 156r-163v) – XIX(8/fols. 164r-171v) – XX(8/fols. 172r-179v) – XXI(8/fols. 180r-187v) – XXII(8/fols. 188r-195v) – XXII(8/fols. 196r-203v) – XXIV(fols. 204r-205v).
Fols. 12r-15v, 22r-25v are wrongly inserted and rebound within Quire II; as a consequence, part of Texts I-7 and I-8 are misplaced inside Text I-3. This is not easily visible from the quire structure and the binding, but only according to the text.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling (below on fol. 203va).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina Sacra. Names of the king and commissioner. A few lines alternating with black lines in the incipit page of Text I-1 and in the incipit page of the section for the day hours of Friday (in Text I-8); headings and incipits of the texts, their sections and subsections; titles of the Biblical books and other works; names of Hebrew letters in Text I-8; directives for the ministers in Texts I-7and I-9; initial words or letters in “Tǝmḫǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat” (Text I-8); the words: yǝbe, yǝtärägwǝm and yǝbe mätärgwǝm in Text I-8. Elements of the punctuation signs, of Ethiopic numerals and of the text dividers.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይ፡ ሕ፡ for ይብል፡ ሕዝብ፡ (in Text I-7; e.g., fols. 114va, 114vb, 115ra) ይ፡ ካ፡ for ይብል፡ ካህን፡ (in Text I-7; e.g., fols. 114va, 114vc, 115ra, 115rc, 115vb-c) ይ፡ ዲ፡ for ይብል፡ ዲያቆን፡ (in Texts I-7 and I-9; e.g., fols. 114vc, 115ra, 115rc, 115vb, 197rb) ይተረጕ᎓ for ይተረጕም᎓ (in Text I-8; e.g., fols. 146vb, 147rb) ኪ፡/ኪር፡ for ኪራላይሶን፡ (Text I-8; fol. 172rc) ስቡሕኒ፡ for ስቡሕኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልዑልኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ለዓለም፡ (in Text I-8; fols. 187va-188ra) ወይ፡ እግ᎓ ተ᎓ ጸ፡/ወይ፡ እግ፡ ጸ፡ for ወይብሉ፡ እግዚኦ፡ ተሣሃለነ፡ ጸልዩ፡ (in Text I-9; fols. 204ra-205rc)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Fols. 12r-15v, 22r-25v (part of Texts I-7 and I-8) are misplaced: they are wrongly inserted and rebound within Quire II, so that part of Texts I-7 and I-8 is inside Text I-3 (s. above “Short content”). This is not easily visible from the quire structure and the binding, but possible to note if one examines the text. - On fols. 162rc-va, the Homily by Jaqob of Serug on Abraham (in Text I-8) ends with a subscriptio ascribing the translation of the homily (from Arabic into Gǝʿǝz) to Metropolitan ʾabba Sälama (Metropolitan from 1350 or 1348; cp. EAE IV, 488-89); besides, the authorship of the work is here attributed (?) to Athanasius (Bishop of Alexandria from 328 to 373; cp. EAE I, 392): ወይረሲ፡ ማኅደሮ፡ ለአቡነ፡ አባ፡ ሰላማ፡ ጳጳስነ፡ ወወ[sic]ምስሌሆሙ፡ ደርገ፡ አሜን፨ ለዝንቱ፡ ድርሳን፡ ዘአጽሐፎ፡ አቡነ፡ አባ፡ ሰላማ፡ ጳጳስ፡ ርቱዓ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ እመጽሐፈ፡ ዚአሁ፡ ለግዕዝ፡ ወይተሉ፡ ዝየ፡ ተጽሕፎ፡ ዘይቤ፡ አባ፡ አትናትዮስ፨ ለዘጸሐፎ፡ ወለዘአጽሐፎ፡ ይጸሐፍ፡ ስሞሙ፡ በመንግሥተ፡ ሰማይ። ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስሌነ፡ አሜን፨ ፨ - In some parts of the text, the rubrication is missing (s. the punctuations), looking like it has not been completed: fols. 98v-99r, 157v-162r.

colophon.col: Fol. 131rc: ተፈጸመት፡ ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ግብረ፡ ሕማማት፡ ዘትትነበብ፡ በሰሙነ፡ ሕማማት፡ በወርኃ፡ ሰኔ፡ በ፳ወ፱ሌሊት፡ ወበ፳በስሙኑ፡ መዓልት፡ እለ፡ ተልዕክዋሰ፡ ኒቆዲሞስ፡ ፈቃደ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ አግናጥዮስ፨ ወለጸሐፊሃ፡ አልባስጥሮስ፡ ወለዘአጽሐፊሃሰ፡ [n.l.] ለታቦተ፡ …
colophon.det: This note states that the Ms. was completed during the month of Säne, in the 2nd week before Easter, the “Week zä-Niqodimos” (cp. Fritsch, 2011, pp. 206-210). The year is not specified. About the scribe’s mention, it is not clear whether Albasṭros is his real name or a nickname. The names of the commissioner and of the tabot to which this book belongs are erased. The note seems written in a more faded ink.

additional.cont: Fol. 205rb-rc: Ownership note.
additional.det: This note, written in the main hand, says that the book belongs to the tabot of Qusqwam (most likely one of the tabots of the church Maryam Mäkan); besides, it mentions, like in the colophon (fol. 131rc), Albasṭros as the name (?) of the scribe.

extras.extra: - Space for rubricated names left unfilled in the supplication formulas: e.g., fols. 179vc, 204rc, 204va, 180rc. - Corrections (words or letters) written interlineally: fols. 17rc, 30va, 45vc, 59ra, 61rb, 69va, 182vb. - Erasures: e.g., fols. 27rb, 148rb. - Erasures marked with parallel lines: e.g., fols. 55vc, 116vb. - Corrections over erasures: e.g., fols. 148rb, 156ra, 156rc. - On fols. 142r and 203v, part of the text continues outside the layout, in the upper and bottom margin, in a compressed script. - Writing exercise (?) in the bottom margin of fol. 168r. - Crude recent notes in pen in the margins of fols. 129v-130r, 134v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - On fol. 51ra, an omitted passage from the text (i.e. ቅድመ፡ ወንገል፡), introducing the reading from the Gospel of Luke for the first night hour of Tuesday, is written in the bottom margin. - Excerpts of hymns for the Good Friday (?) written (mostly in black; also in red on fol. 173v; some with a frame below) in the upper margin of fols. 132r, 141v, 142v, 143r, 145r, 151v, 152r, 152v, 162v, 169v, 170r, 170v, 171r, 173v, 179r, 179v, 182v.
